step1.sentence: Even the most successful entrepreneurs experience setbacks before they finally break through.

step2.story: During her first year of training, Mia began to experience setbacks that tested her resolve. Injuries and missed competitions made her doubt herself, but she kept showing up every morning. Slowly, she learned that setbacks were part of the journey, not the end of it.

step3.story: James had spent three years building his startup, pouring every spare hour into the product he believed in. When a major investor pulled out and a key engineer resigned in the same week, James began to experience setbacks that felt impossible to recover from. He sat alone in his office that Friday evening, staring at a blank spreadsheet, wondering if he had made a terrible mistake. But by Sunday morning, he had called his remaining team together and reframed the situation as a chance to rebuild smarter. They stripped the product down to its core, found a smaller but loyal customer base, and moved forward one careful step at a time. James later said that learning to experience setbacks without losing his sense of direction was the most valuable lesson his startup ever taught him.

meaning.realUsageKo: 목표를 향해 나아가는 과정에서 실패, 지연, 예상치 못한 어려움을 맞닥뜨리는 상황을 표현할 때 사용한다. 일, 학업, 스포츠, 창업 등 다양한 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'setback'은 16세기 영어에서 '뒤로 물러나게 하는 것'이라는 의미로 등장했으며, 'set back(뒤로 밀어두다)'에서 파생되었다. 오늘날에는 진전을 방해하는 장애나 실패를 뜻한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 실패보다는 노력 중에 겪는 일시적 좌절을 강조하는 표현이다. 포기가 아닌 극복을 전제로 한 맥락에서 자주 사용되어 긍정적인 회복 의지가 함께 암시된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: It's normal to experience setbacks when you're learning something new.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 새로운 것을 배울 때 좌절을 경험하는 것은 자연스러운 일이다.
